title: Failed to request block from beacon node, could not compute eth1data votes
body:
This is an error occurring on E2E, minimal config with 1024 validators, might have something to do with the eth1 dev chain not moving but I changed it to generating new blocks if that was the case.
```
    endtoend_test.go:193: time="2020-01-26 03:36:19" level=error msg="Failed to request block from beacon node" error="rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not compute state root: could not calculate state root at slot 19: could not compute eth1data votes merkleization: could not compute eth1data votes merkleization: merkleizing list that is too large, over limit" prefix=validator pubKey=0xa6d310dbbfab
```

@0xKiwi is this still a problem? The error here is due to a configuration mismatch. The function that computes HTR of eth1 data votes highly depends on the beacon config. Check what it should be in minimal vs. what's defined in the config.go file in shared/params. You might need --define ssz=minimal as well here, but I'm confident this is a config issue.
@rauljordan haven't encountered it since, seems like it's good now.
Great, if it occurs again we just have to check the config values to resolve
